1‚Üí# SpectralCanvas Pro
     2‚Üí
     3‚ÜíA revolutionary spectral manipulation synthesizer that transforms visual painting gestures into musical expression. Paint sound directly on a living spectrogram canvas where "What You See Is What You Hear" (WYSIWYH).
     4‚Üí
     5‚Üí## Current Status: Phase 2/3 Complete ‚úÖ
     6‚Üí
     7‚Üí**Latest Build**: VST3 + Standalone passing **pluginval strictness 6**
     8‚Üí**Stability**: All heap corruption fixes validated and stable
     9‚Üí**New Features**: Progressive spectrogram display + painting scaffolds ready
    10‚Üí
    11‚Üí### Implementation Progress
    12‚Üí
    13‚Üí- ‚úÖ **Phase 1**: Core tiled atlas + message bus + cursor scaffold
    14‚Üí- ‚úÖ **Phase 2**: Progressive spectrogram rendering (CPU fallback + GPU atlas)
    15‚Üí- ‚úÖ **Phase 3**: Painting tools + mask delta queue system
    16‚Üí- üîÑ **Phase 4**: Audio thread mask application (next milestone)
    17‚Üí
    18‚Üí### Key Features (Implemented)
    19‚Üí
    20‚Üí- **Real-time spectral painting** with RT-safe mask delta system
    21‚Üí- **Progressive spectrogram display** with bounded column updates (‚â§64/frame)
    22‚Üí- **Performance HUD** showing FPS, safety counters, and system metrics
    23‚Üí- **Lock-free audio processing** with comprehensive heap corruption protection
    24‚Üí- **BrushTools system** with radial falloff and coalesced updates
    25‚Üí- **Cross-platform support** (Windows complete, CI/CD ready)
    26‚Üí
    27‚Üí## System Requirements
    28‚Üí
    29‚Üí- **Windows**: Windows 10 (1903+) or Windows 11
    30‚Üí- **Audio**: ASIO, DirectSound, or WASAPI compatible interface
    31‚Üí- **CPU**: Modern multi-core processor (Intel i5/AMD Ryzen 5 minimum)
    32‚Üí- **GPU**: DirectX 11.0+ compatible (WARP fallback included)
    33‚Üí- **RAM**: 4GB minimum, 8GB recommended
    34‚Üí- **Storage**: 100MB for installation
    35‚Üí
    36‚Üí## Installation
    37‚Üí
    38‚Üí### Pre-built Releases
    39‚ÜíDownload the latest release from the releases page and run the installer.
    40‚Üí
    41‚Üí### Building from Source
    42‚Üí
    43‚Üí#### Prerequisites
    44‚Üí- CMake 3.22+
    45‚Üí- Visual Studio 2019+ (Windows) or Xcode 13+ (macOS) 
    46‚Üí- Git with submodules support
    47‚Üí
    48‚Üí#### Build Steps
    49‚Üí```bash
    50‚Üí# Clone with submodules
    51‚Üígit clone --recursive https://github.com/your-org/SpectralCanvasPro.git
    52‚Üícd SpectralCanvasPro
    53‚Üí
    54‚Üí# Configure build
    55‚Üícmake -S . -B build -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=RelWithDebInfo -DSCP_INSTALL_SHADERS=ON
    56‚Üí
    57‚Üí# Build plugin
    58‚Üícmake --build build --config RelWithDebInfo
    59‚Üí
    60‚Üí# Outputs:
    61‚Üí# build/SpectralCanvasPro_artefacts/RelWithDebInfo/VST3/SpectralCanvasPro.vst3
    62‚Üí# build/SpectralCanvasPro_artefacts/RelWithDebInfo/Standalone/SpectralCanvasPro.exe
    63‚Üí```
    64‚Üí
    65‚Üí## Quick Start
    66‚Üí
    67‚Üí1. **Load SpectralCanvasPro** in your DAW or run standalone
    68‚Üí2. **Load an audio file** using the "Load sample" button  
    69‚Üí3. **Watch the spectrogram** appear as analysis progresses
    70‚Üí4. **Paint with the brush** - left-click and drag to attenuate frequencies
    71‚Üí5. **Listen in real-time** as the playhead reveals your edits
    72‚Üí6. **Use musical helpers** - enable key filter and harmonic brush for musical results
    73‚Üí
    74‚Üí## Architecture & Development
    75‚Üí
    76‚Üí*This is a passion project focusing on the intersection of visual art and music creation.*
    77‚Üí
    78‚Üí---
    79‚Üí
    80‚Üí## FINAL SPEC & AUTHORITATIVE ROADMAP
    81‚Üí
    82‚Üí*This section serves as the definitive technical specification. Do not change file/namespace/type names, constants, or commit titles without updating this document.*
    83‚Üí
    84‚Üí## Inspiration, Idea, & Musical Vision
    85‚Üí
    86‚Üí**Inspiration**
    87‚ÜíSpectralCanvas Pro grew from the lineage of *MetaSynth* and spectral art ‚Äî the idea that an image *is* the instrument. We want visual creation to be musical: every brushstroke must create musically sensible, expressive results, whether sculpting a recorded sample or painting sound from scratch.
    88‚Üí
    89‚Üí**Core idea**
    90‚ÜíPresent a tiled spectrogram of audio (or an empty canvas) and let users paint an editable mask or paint magnitudes directly. The playhead sweeps; painted edits are heard instantly. Add musical helpers (key-aware filters, harmonic guides, pitch grid, piano-strip) so creative actions are inherently musical.
    91‚Üí
    92‚Üí**What ‚Äúmusical‚Äù means here**
    93‚Üí
    94‚Üí* Brushes are pitch-aware (harmonic brush, key filter) and produce musically coherent spectral changes.
    95‚Üí* Visual feedback maps to musical constructs: piano-strip, semitone/octave grid, harmonic helper lines, pitch-snapping guides.
    96‚Üí* Z-Plane morph filter and tube saturation give character that musicians expect (warmth, movement)‚Äîthese are on the roadmap and will be integrated as controllable, musical effects, optionally ‚Äúbaked‚Äù into a hidden processing chain for demos.
    97‚Üí
    98‚Üí**One-sentence mission**
    99‚ÜíMake spectral creation immediate, musical, and playable ‚Äî where visual gestures become reliable musical outcomes.
   100‚Üí
   101‚Üí---
   102‚Üí
   103‚Üí## CANONICAL RULES (non-negotiable)
   104‚Üí
   105‚Üí* **Namespaces**: `atlas`, `bus`, `analysis`, `dspx`, `viz`, `tools`.
   106‚Üí* **Files & paths**: create and maintain the exact file paths listed in the FILES section below.
   107‚Üí* **Constants (single source)**: `Source/Core/AtlasIds.h` is the canonical constants file. Defaults (MLP):
   108‚Üí
   109‚Üí  ```cpp
   110‚Üí  FFT = 2048
   111‚Üí  HOP = 256
   112‚Üí  BINS = FFT / 2     // 1024
   113‚Üí  TILE_H = BINS
   114‚Üí  TILE_W = 2048
   115‚Üí  ```
   116‚Üí* **Messaging & threading**: UI‚ÜîAudio communication only via `bus::SpscQueue<MaskColumnDelta, N>`. No locks/allocations in `processBlock()`. Audio thread never memcpy's whole tiles ‚Äî columns only into inactive staging page, then atomic flip per tile.
   117‚Üí* **Delta shape** (frozen):
   118‚Üí
   119‚Üí  ```cpp
   120‚Üí  struct MaskColumnDelta {
   121‚Üí    uint32_t tileId;
   122‚Üí    uint16_t colInTile;
   123‚Üí    uint16_t bins; // == atlas::TILE_H
   124‚Üí    uint32_t generation;
   125‚Üí    float    gain[atlas::TILE_H];
   126‚Üí  };
   127‚Üí  ```
   128‚Üí* **Commit titles**: use the exact commit slice titles in this document for PRs.
   129‚Üí
   130‚Üí---
   131‚Üí
   132‚Üí## FINAL FEATURE SET (what this plugin *is*)
   133‚Üí
   134‚Üí### Core (v1 MLP)
   135‚Üí
   136‚Üí1. **Load WAV/AIFF** (mono mixdown OK). Progressive offline analysis.
   137‚Üí2. **Tiled spectrogram canvas** (GPU-backed when available; CPU fallback). Linear-frequency default.
   138‚Üí3. **Attenuation brush**: 0..1 mask, radial falloff, per-column deltas, coalesced, RT-safe.
   139‚Üí4. **Transport-accurate playback**: STFT ‚Üí apply mask column ‚Üí iFFT + OLA; yellow playhead cursor (atomic).
   140‚Üí5. **Musical helpers**: piano-strip, semitone/octave grid, harmonic lines (visual), pitch LUT for later log mapping.
   141‚Üí6. **UX**: blank canvas with ‚ÄúLoad sample‚Äù CTA and optional ‚ÄúDraw synth (Beta)‚Äù toggle.
   142‚Üí
   143‚Üí### Musical-first extensions (v1.1 & roadmap)
   144‚Üí
   145‚Üí1. **Keyfilter** ‚Äî key-aware filter: maps canvas vertical positions to scale/key; can auto-focus/amplify notes in current key; harmonically-aware attenuation/boosting.
   146‚Üí2. **Harmonic Brush** ‚Äî paint a fundamental and apply harmonics (2√ó,3√ó,‚Ä¶) with per-octave strength.
   147‚Üí3. **Log-frequency shader** & pitch grid ‚Äî visual alignment to musical notes; snapping options.
   148‚Üí4. **Mipmaps/LOD** for long-file zoom levels.
   149‚Üí5. **Draw-from-scratch (MetaSynth mode)** ‚Äî paint magnitudes directly to create sound from nothing.
   150‚Üí6. **Z-Plane morph filter** & **Tube Saturation** ‚Äî musical character modules (secret source / baked options available for demos).
   151‚Üí
   152‚Üí---
   153‚Üí
   154‚Üí## VISUAL FEEDBACK RULES (how visuals make everything musical)
   155‚Üí
   156‚Üí* **Piano strip** left of canvas; clicking focuses brush frequency or snaps harmonic brush.
   157‚Üí* **Octave/semitone grid**: thin semitone lines, thicker octave lines, labeled notes at readable zoom levels.
   158‚Üí* **Harmonic helper lines**: when harmonic brush active, highlight integer-multiple frequency lines.
   159‚Üí* **Cursor**: bright yellow 1px with soft glow; read from `std::atomic<int> currentColumn`.
   160‚Üí* **Mask overlay**: visual-only tint where mask < 1 (alpha scaled); do not alter base spectrogram display values ‚Äî audio is the truth.
   161‚Üí* **Color maps**: Fire (MetaSynth vibe), Greyscale, Ice; gamma control to avoid banding.
   162‚Üí* **Keyfilter indicator**: highlights in-scale harmonics when a key is selected.
   163‚Üí
   164‚Üí---
   165‚Üí
   166‚Üí## DATA MODEL & THREAD CONTRACTS (authoritative)
   167‚Üí
   168‚Üí* **SpectralAtlas (CPU FP32)**: sparse tiles, column-major storage `[col][bin]`.
   169‚Üí* **MaskAtlas (CPU FP32 double-page)**: `page[2]`, `activePageIndex` (atomic), `generation` (atomic). UI writes staging page; audio reads active.
   170‚Üí* **SPSC queue**: `bus::SpscQueue<MaskColumnDelta, 1024>` ‚Äî UI pushes, audio pops. Coalesce before push.
   171‚Üí* **Audio**: drains ‚â§16 deltas/block (configurable). Each delta `memcpy` to staging column (`sizeof(float)*TILE_H`) then `flipActivePage()`. No locks; no allocations.
   172‚Üí* **Column‚ÜíTile math**:
   173‚Üí
   174‚Üí  ```text
   175‚Üí  column = floor((playheadSamples - startOffsetSamples) / HOP)
   176‚Üí  tileId = column / TILE_W
   177‚Üí  colInTile = column % TILE_W
   178‚Üí  ```
   179‚Üí
   180‚Üí---
   181‚Üí
   182‚Üí## PHASED ACTIONS (do in order; each item is a discrete PR)
   183‚Üí
   184‚Üí### PHASE 0 ‚Äî Prep & repo hygiene
   185‚Üí
   186‚Üí1. Add `docs/FINAL_SPEC.md` (this file) and keep `docs/MLP_STEP_BY_STEP.md` canonical for code details.
   187‚Üí2. Move legacy files to `Source/legacy/`.
   188‚Üí3. Ensure clean/build scripts and CMake shader option exist.
   189‚Üí4. Link README ‚Üí this document.
   190‚Üí
   191‚Üí### PHASE 1 ‚Äî Core plumbing + cursor (Build)
   192‚Üí
   193‚Üí1. Add `Source/Core/AtlasIds.h` (constants).
   194‚Üí2. Add `Source/Core/MessageBus.h` (MaskColumnDelta + SPSC).
   195‚Üí3. Add `Source/Core/TiledAtlas.h/.cpp` (SpectralTile + MaskTile).
   196‚Üí4. Add `Source/DSP/HopScheduler.h/.cpp` (prepare, applyMaskDeltas, tick).
   197‚Üí5. Wire `PluginProcessor`/`PluginEditor` with `currentColumn` atomic and `SpectrogramComponent` (grid + cursor).
   198‚Üí   **Commit:** `Build: core tiled atlas + message bus + cursor scaffold`.
   199‚Üí
   200‚Üí### PHASE 2 ‚Äî Offline analyzer & progressive spectrogram (SEE)
   201‚Üí
   202‚Üí1. Implement `Source/Analysis/OfflineStftAnalyzer.h/.cpp` (worker STFT, column writes, progress/cancel).
   203‚Üí2. Implement per-column upload path in `SpectrogramComponent` (‚â§64 uploads/frame).
   204‚Üí3. Add file-load UI (WAV/AIFF) and decode via `juce_audio_formats`.
   205‚Üí   **Commit:** `GUI: progressive spectrogram (per-column uploads)`.
   206‚Üí
   207‚Üí### PHASE 3 ‚Äî Painting + delta emission (EDIT)
   208‚Üí
   209‚Üí1. Implement `Source/GUI/BrushTools.h/.cpp` (GainBrush, Eraser).
   210‚Üí2. Map canvas XY ‚Üí (column, bin); radial falloff; compute `gain[TILE_H]`.
   211‚Üí3. Coalesce per frame by `(tileId,colInTile)`; push ‚â§128 deltas/frame to SPSC.
   212‚Üí4. UI writes staging columns for visual immediacy.
   213‚Üí   **Commit:** `Tools: attenuation brush + column delta emitter`.
   214‚Üí
   215‚Üí### PHASE 4 ‚Äî Apply mask in DSP (HEAR)
   216‚Üí
   217‚Üí1. In audio thread: `hop.applyMaskDeltas(maskQ, atlas)` (bounded drain, memcpy, flip).
   218‚Üí2. In STFT hop: compute column from playhead, load mask active column, multiply mags, iFFT+OLA, store `currentColumn`.
   219‚Üí3. Latency: `setLatencySamples(FFT/2)` placeholder; refine later.
   220‚Üí   **Commit:** `DSP: apply mask per hop (WYSIWYH)`.
   221‚Üí
   222‚Üí### PHASE 5 ‚Äî Musical UX & Keyfilter
   223‚Üí
   224‚Üí1. Add **Keyfilter** control: choose musical key & scale; brush/harmonic tools respect key.
   225‚Üí2. Piano-strip & pitch grid with pitch-snapping toggle.
   226‚Üí3. Harmonic brush: paint fundamentals and map to harmonics.
   227‚Üí   **Commit:** `UX: keyfilter, piano strip, harmonic brush`.
   228‚Üí
   229‚Üí### PHASE 6 ‚Äî Polish, LOD, and MLP release
   230‚Üí
   231‚Üí1. HUD metrics, budget guards, stability tests.
   232‚Üí2. CPU‚ÜíGPU FP16 column uploads; GPU rendering optimized.
   233‚Üí3. `Draw-from-scratch` mode gating and export pipeline.
   234‚Üí   **Commit:** `MLP: polish, budgets, release`.
   235‚Üí
   236‚Üí### PHASE 7 ‚Äî Post-MLP advanced features
   237‚Üí
   238‚Üí1. Z-Plane morph filter (spec file integrated as `Source/DSP/ZPlaneFilter.*`).
   239‚Üí2. Tube saturation, character chain, Hybrid mode (Synth/Resynth blending).
   240‚Üí3. Presets, image‚Üíaudio import/export, LOD improvements.
   241‚Üí   **Commit:** `PostMLP: advanced sound design features`.
   242‚Üí
   243‚Üí---
   244‚Üí
   245‚Üí## DETAILED UI BEHAVIOR (final rules)
   246‚Üí
   247‚Üí* **Blank canvas** shows large centered CTA ‚ÄúLoad sample‚Äù. A smaller **Draw synth (Beta)** toggle is visible and available but off by default.
   248‚Üí* **Top strip**: Load, Mode (hidden until post-MLP), Brush size/strength, Keyfilter dropdown, Zoom controls, Freeze view, Debug HUD toggle.
   249‚Üí* **Canvas**: main spectrogram, mask overlay, piano-strip at left (toggle), zoom & pan (mouse wheel/drag), fit-to-file button.
   250‚Üí* **Brush input**: left-drag paints, right-drag pans, wheel changes radius, shift toggles strength.
   251‚Üí* **On paint**: UI updates staging page and optionally draws overlay immediately. Emission to SPSC occurs per-frame coalesced.
   252‚Üí* **Cursor**: reads `currentColumn` atomic $60 Hz UI refresh recommended$.
   253‚Üí
   254‚Üí---
   255‚Üí
   256‚Üí## ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA (final)
   257‚Üí
   258‚Üí* **SEE**: Load a 1‚Äì3 minute file; spectrogram appears progressively with tiles; UI responds at ‚âà60 fps while analyzing.
   259‚Üí* **EDIT**: Painting produces bounded deltas (no runaway memory), visual overlay shows changes, UI remains responsive.
   260‚Üí* **HEAR**: Painted attenuation (or harmonic additions in harmonic brush) audible ‚â§ 1 hop after paint when cursor crosses; no clicks, NaNs, or xruns at 44.1/48/96 kHz and block sizes 64..1024.
   261‚Üí* **STABILITY**: pluginval Automation tests pass (strictness 8) on Windows and macOS builds used in CI.
   262‚Üí* **MUSICALITY**: Keyfilter + harmonic helpers produce musically coherent results by default (no user tuning required to hear musical output).
   263‚Üí
   264‚Üí---
   265‚Üí
   266‚Üí## RUNBOOK (final)
   267‚Üí
   268‚Üí```bash
   269‚Üí# Configure
   270‚Üícmake -S . -B build -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=RelWithDebInfo -DSCP_INSTALL_SHADERS=ON
   271‚Üí
   272‚Üí# Build Standalone
   273‚Üícmake --build build --config RelWithDebInfo --target SpectralCanvasPro_Standalone
   274‚Üí
   275‚Üí# Build VST3
   276‚Üícmake --build build --config RelWithDebInfo --target SpectralCanvasPro_VST3
   277‚Üí
   278‚Üí# Validate (example)
   279‚Üípluginval --strictness-level 8 --skip-gui-tests build/SpectralCanvasPro_artefacts/RelWithDebInfo/VST3/SpectralCanvasPro.vst3
   280‚Üí```
   281‚Üí
   282‚ÜíWindows tip: if FetchContent lock errors occur, use a fresh build folder (e.g., `build_mlprun`) or follow the clean script in `scripts/clean.ps1`.
   283‚Üí
   284‚Üí---
   285‚Üí
   286‚Üí## FILES ‚Äî exact authoritative list (create these; do not rename)
   287‚Üí
   288‚Üí```
   289‚Üídocs/FINAL_SPEC.md            # (this file)
   290‚Üídocs/MLP_STEP_BY_STEP.md     # canonical code-level spec
   291‚Üídocs/ROADMAP_ACTIONS_PHASED.md
   292‚ÜíSource/Core/AtlasIds.h
   293‚ÜíSource/Core/MessageBus.h
   294‚ÜíSource/Core/TiledAtlas.h
   295‚ÜíSource/Core/TiledAtlas.cpp
   296‚ÜíSource/DSP/HopScheduler.h
   297‚ÜíSource/DSP/HopScheduler.cpp
   298‚ÜíSource/Analysis/OfflineStftAnalyzer.h
   299‚ÜíSource/Analysis/OfflineStftAnalyzer.cpp
   300‚ÜíSource/GUI/SpectrogramComponent.h
   301‚ÜíSource/GUI/SpectrogramComponent.cpp
   302‚ÜíSource/GUI/BrushTools.h
   303‚ÜíSource/GUI/BrushTools.cpp
   304‚ÜíSource/PluginProcessor.h
   305‚ÜíSource/PluginProcessor.cpp
   306‚ÜíSource/PluginEditor.h
   307‚ÜíSource/PluginEditor.cpp
   308‚ÜíSource/DSP/ZPlaneFilter.*     # Post-MLP (spec exists)
   309‚ÜíCMakeLists.txt
   310‚Üíscripts/build.sh
   311‚Üíscripts/build.ps1
   312‚Üíscripts/clean.sh
   313‚Üíscripts/clean.ps1
   314‚ÜíSource/legacy/*               # backups (if any)
   315‚Üí```
   316‚Üí
   317‚Üí## Errata & Clarifications
   318‚Üí- generation: tracks page swaps, prevents stale updates.
   319‚Üí- Coalescing: last-write-wins per (tileId,colInTile) each frame.
   320‚Üí- Acceptance edge cases: 
   321‚Üí  - File load errors ‚Üí toast + recover.
   322‚Üí  - Brush params spam ‚Üí stable, no crashes.
   323‚Üí- Draw Synth toggle ‚Üí hides Load CTA and shows empty canvas.
   324‚Üí- Musical test: harmonic brush in C major generates only in-scale harmonics.
   325‚Üí
   326‚Üí
   327‚Üí---
   328‚Üí
   329‚Üí## TESTS & TELEMETRY (dev responsibilities)
   330‚Üí
   331‚Üí* Add unit/integration tests for:
   332‚Üí
   333‚Üí  * `atlas::samplesToColumn` mapping.
   334‚Üí  * `MaskColumnDelta` size invariants.
   335‚Üí  * `hop.applyMaskDeltas` bounded drain & no whole-tile memcpy.
   336‚Üí* Add HUD counters (atomics):
   337‚Üí
   338‚Üí  * `maskQDepth`, `maskDrops`, `deltaDrainsPerBlock`, `badBinSkips`, `hopTimeUs`.
   339‚Üí* Run pluginval + automated playback tests in CI for each PR.
   340‚Üí
   341‚Üí---
   342‚Üí
   343‚Üí## FINAL NOTE (from the heart)
   344‚Üí
   345‚ÜíThis is the definitive, final design document for SpectralCanvas Pro. It captures the product vision, the musical-first philosophy, the technical invariants that keep the audio thread safe, and an actionable phased roadmap. Treat this project as a craft: ship the MLP (See ‚Üí Paint ‚Üí Hear) with musical helpers (Keyfilter, harmonic guidance) and then let the magic layers (Z-Plane, Tube saturation, MetaSynth-style painting) amplify the instrument.

   347‚ÜíIf you hand this file to any engineer, AI, or collaborator, they should be able to continue work without ambiguity. Make art. Make music. Keep it safe in DAWs.

Looking at this README, I can see that Gemini understood most of the project correctly, but there are some important gaps and misalignments:

**What Gemini Got Right:**
- The "image IS the sound" concept and spectral art inspiration
- The importance of immediate Paint ‚Üí sonic response 
- The hybrid visual/artistic + scientific approach
- The progressive disclosure philosophy (Load+Paint+Hear first)
- The focus on musicality over clinical analysis

**What Gemini Missed or Got Wrong:**
1. **Current State**: Gemini didn't realize we're already at Phase 2/3 complete with existing infrastructure
2. **File Structure**: The actual file structure is different from what Gemini assumed - we have SpectralCanvasProAudioProcessor.h/.cpp, not PluginProcessor.h/.cpp
3. **Existing Components**: We already have MinimalTopStrip, SpectrogramComponent, BrushTools, MaskDeltaQueue, etc. - Gemini was suggesting we create things that already exist
4. **Phase 4 Priority**: The README makes it clear that Phase 4 (HEAR - "apply mask per hop") is the next critical milestone, not a later nice-to-have
5. **RT-Safety Focus**: Gemini understood this but didn't fully grasp that the existing architecture is already designed around RT-safety with SPSC queues, atomic operations, etc.
6. **Technical Constraints**: The FINAL SPEC section has very specific technical requirements (FFT=2048, HOP=256, etc.) that Gemini didn't reference

**Key Misalignments:**
- Gemini suggested starting with "stubbed silent output" but the FINAL SPEC clearly expects Phase 4 to implement actual STFT mask application
- Gemini didn't understand that we already have the UI components mostly built and just need to wire them together
- The creative direction advice was good but somewhat generic - it didn't account for the specific technical architecture we've already built
 
Gemini's analysis revealed a surface-level understanding that missed the project's nuanced technical depth and current implementation state. While offering creative insights, the AI failed to grasp the sophisticated infrastructure already in place, overlooking critical technical specifics and existing architectural choices.

Looking at the README, I can see Gemini understood the **creative vision** really well but missed some critical **technical context**:

## **‚úÖ What Gemini Got Right:**
- **"Paint ‚Üí immediate sonic response"** as the core magic
- **Hybrid spectral-art aesthetic** (scientific + artistic)  
- **Musical-first philosophy** over clinical analysis
- **Progressive disclosure** strategy

Here‚Äôs a one-pass Claude Code prompt block you can drop in. It‚Äôs formatted for Plan Mode and pins all non-negotiables so HEAR goes live without guesswork.

CLAUDE.md / Phase 4 (HEAR) ‚Äî Implementation Task (RT-safe STFT masking with column atlas)

Context & repo assumptions

* JUCE plugin; AtlasConfig::{FFT\_SIZE, HOP\_SIZE, NUM\_BINS, TILE\_WIDTH, TILE\_HEIGHT} already defined.
* ColumnOps.h provides atlas::copyColumn(dstCol\[NUM\_BINS], srcCol\[NUM\_BINS]).
* MessageBus.h defines MaskDeltaQueue (SPSC) and MaskColumnDelta { Position position; float values\[NUM\_BINS]; } where position.columnInTile indexes 0..TILE\_WIDTH-1.
* AtlasIds.h defines AtlasConfig.\* and tile geometry.
* Phase 4 (HEAR) wires UI paint ‚Üí audio attenuation by scaling STFT magnitudes per active mask column.

Primary goal
On every hop, scale the input frame‚Äôs complex FFT bins by the active mask column (0..1), preserving phase, then iFFT + overlap-add. Painting must immediately attenuate painted bands.

Hard RT rules

* Absolutely no locks or heap allocations on the audio thread (processBlock()). Preallocate everything in prepare.
* Drain ‚â§16 UI deltas per processBlock() into a staging page, then atomically flip the active page exactly once if any deltas arrived.
* Copy exactly one column (NUM\_BINS floats) per delta ‚Äî never whole tiles.
* Report host latency = FFT\_SIZE - HOP\_SIZE.

Data path (authoritative)
UI Brush ‚Üí MaskDeltaQueue (SPSC)
Audio processBlock:

1. drainAndApply(‚â§16): copy column ‚Üí staging page, flip once if applied>0
2. for each hop advanced by this block:
   take last FFT\_SIZE input samples ‚Üí analysis window ‚Üí FFT (real‚Üícomplex)
   scale complex bins by maskColumn (preserve phase by uniform scaling)
   iFFT ‚Üí synthesis window ‚Üí overlap‚Äìadd ‚Üí write output

Files to add (exact APIs)

1. Source/Core/MaskAtlas.h
   Purpose: double-page atlas of mask columns with atomic flip. Height = NUM\_BINS.
   API:
   void prepare();                                       // allocates two pages \[TILE\_WIDTH \* NUM\_BINS], initializes to 1.0
   void writeStagingColumn(int colInTile, const float\* values) noexcept; // NUM\_BINS
   void flip() noexcept;                                 // atomic page swap + generation++
   const float\* activeColumn(int colInTile) const noexcept;
   uint32\_t generation() const noexcept;
   Requirements:

   * pages\_\[2] unique\_ptr\<float\[]> sized TILE\_WIDTH \* NUM\_BINS each
   * active\_ (atomic<int>) indexes the active page; staging is 1 - active
   * gen\_ (atomic\<uint32\_t>) increments on flip
   * static\_assert(AtlasConfig::TILE\_HEIGHT == AtlasConfig::NUM\_BINS)

2. Source/DSP/HopScheduler.h
   Purpose: bridge UI deltas ‚Üí MaskAtlas; maintain hop index and time‚Üícolumn mapping.
   API:
   void prepare(double sr);
   void setQueue(MaskDeltaQueue\*);
   void drainAndApply(uint32\_t maxDeltas = 16) noexcept;   // drop out-of-bounds columns
   void advance(uint32\_t numSamples) noexcept;             // bump samplePos and hopIdx
   int  currentColInTile() const noexcept;                 // hopIdx % TILE\_WIDTH
   const float\* activeMaskCol(int colInTile) const noexcept;
   uint32\_t drainsPerBlock() const noexcept;
   Internals:

   * Keep sr\_, hop\_ (AtlasConfig::HOP\_SIZE), samplePos\_ (u64), hopIdx\_ (u64)
   * MaskAtlas mask\_; MaskDeltaQueue\* q\_{}
   * drains\_ (u32) set each block (for HUD)
   * drainAndApply(): pop up to maxDeltas, write NUM\_BINS column per delta via atlas::copyColumn, flip once if any applied>0

3. Source/DSP/RealtimeSpectral.h
   Purpose: real-time forward STFT ‚Üí magnitude scaling ‚Üí inverse + OLA (mono).
   API:
   void prepare(double sr, int fft, int hop);
   void processBlock(const float\* in, float\* out, int numSamples, const float\* maskCol);
   Strict requirements:

   * Preallocate all buffers in prepare(): analysis buffer fftSize, temp window buffer fftSize (DO NOT allocate per call), interleaved complex spec fftSize, OLA buffer (fftSize + hop), input FIFO hop-accumulating with slide of fftSize - hop, plus any scratch you need.
   * No dynamic allocations, no std::vector growth, no new/delete in processBlock().
   * Use Hann for analysis and synthesis; reuse prebuilt JUCE windows.
   * Handle arbitrary numSamples via internal hop FIFO. When fifo reaches hop, assemble last fftSize samples (shift by hop), window, FFT, per-bin scale:
     For k in \[0..(fft/2-1)]: scale re,im by s where s = (maskCol ? maskCol\[k] : 1.0f).
     Then inverse FFT, apply synthesis window, overlap‚Äìadd:

     * Write out exactly hop samples each hop (OLA circular buffer), accumulate the tail \[hop..fftSize) back into OLA.
   * Preserve phase (uniform scaling of real+imag pair).
   * Treat maskCol==nullptr as all-ones.
   * Ensure denormals are handled safely in caller (see glue).

Processor glue to add (no allocations in processBlock)

* Members:
  MaskDeltaQueue maskDeltaQueue\_;
  HopScheduler   hop\_;
  RealtimeSpectral rt\_;
* prepareToPlay(sr, block):
  hop\_.prepare(sr); hop\_.setQueue(\&maskDeltaQueue\_);
  rt\_.prepare(sr, AtlasConfig::FFT\_SIZE, AtlasConfig::HOP\_SIZE);
  setLatencySamples(AtlasConfig::FFT\_SIZE - AtlasConfig::HOP\_SIZE);
  jassert(getLatencySamples() == AtlasConfig::FFT\_SIZE - AtlasConfig::HOP\_SIZE);
  Configure denormals off for processing scope (see below).
* processBlock(buffer, midi):
  Use juce::ScopedNoDenormals guard at function start.
  Mono policy: read channel 0 as input; zero all outputs up front.
  hop\_.drainAndApply(16);
  rt\_.processBlock(inMono, outMono, numSamples, hop\_.activeMaskCol(hop\_.currentColInTile()));
  Copy outMono to all output channels.
  hop\_.advance(numSamples).

Non-negotiables (pin these)

* Project constants: only use AtlasConfig::{FFT\_SIZE, HOP\_SIZE, NUM\_BINS, TILE\_WIDTH, TILE\_HEIGHT}; include static\_assert(height==NUM\_BINS).
* Queues & copies: ‚â§16 deltas per audio block; copy exactly one column (NUM\_BINS floats) per delta via atlas::copyColumn; never full tiles.
* RT safety: zero locks; zero heap in processBlock(); reuse preallocated buffers only.
* Latency: setLatencySamples(FFT\_SIZE - HOP\_SIZE) and assert it; never reset to 0 elsewhere.
* Denormals: disable inside processBlock via juce::ScopedNoDenormals; ensure any global flags are restored in releaseResources().
* Channel policy now: process mono internally; write identical audio to all outputs.

Edge cases to handle

* Block size ‚â† hop: internal FIFO must handle arbitrary numSamples.
* Null mask: treat as all-ones.
* Bounds: silently drop deltas where columnInTile ‚â• TILE\_WIDTH.
* Sample rate / buffer changes: prepareToPlay reinitializes FFT, windows, FIFO, and zeros OLA.
* Paint bursts: multiple deltas drained ‚Üí flip once per block at most.
* Denormals: ensure no subnormal flush issues in tight loops.

Acceptance (must verify in code & tests)

* Painting audibly attenuates bands (pink noise & drum loop).
* Perf HUD: drainsPerBlock > 0 while painting; maskDropCount \~ 0 at reasonable brush rates.
* pluginval --strictness 6 passes.
* Reported latency equals FFT\_SIZE - HOP\_SIZE (and is non-zero).
* Audit: no allocations in processBlock() (grep for new, resize, push\_back, etc.; ensure any temporary like ‚ÄútimeWin‚Äù is preallocated).

Perf/HUD signals to expose

* hop\_.drainsPerBlock() for on-screen HUD.
* Optional: hop\_.currentHop(), mask\_.generation() for debug counters.
* maskDropCount in UI queue producer (if you track drops).

Common pitfalls (call out in review)

* Accidentally allocating in processBlock() (e.g., constructing std::vector or copying to new heap buffer each hop). Fix by preallocating a reusable temp buffer for the analysis window copy.
* Recomputing FFT/window objects per block (must be in prepare()).
* memcpy‚Äôing whole tiles instead of a single NUM\_BINS column.
* Reading past TILE\_WIDTH or NUM\_BINS.
* Forgetting to maintain OLA ring size = fftSize + hop, causing wrap glitches.

Plan Mode workflow (follow this sequence)

1. PLAN: List the exact file adds/edits, buffer sizes, and how you‚Äôll guarantee zero allocations in processBlock(). Explicitly note the preallocated ‚ÄútempWin\_‚Äù (or equivalent) you will add to RealtimeSpectral to replace any per-call std::vector copies.
2. REVIEW: Confirm the hop scheduler‚Äôs time‚Üícolumn mapping (colInTile = hopIdx % TILE\_WIDTH) and the single atomic flip per block when applied>0.
3. IMPLEMENT: Create the three headers and wire the processor glue exactly as specified. Ensure all windows/FFTs/buffers are built in prepare(); zero OLA.
4. VERIFY: Run unit/manual tests:

   * Standalone: load a 10‚Äì60s WAV. Paint highs ‚Üí highs drop; paint lows ‚Üí lows drop.
   * HUD shows drains/block > 0 while painting; mask drops ‚âà 0.
   * Confirm setLatencySamples() equals FFT\_SIZE - HOP\_SIZE at runtime.
   * pluginval --strictness 6 ‚Üí PASS.
5. OUTPUT: Provide a concise git patch (unified diff) covering added headers and processor edits, plus a short commit message:
   Title (‚â§6 words): ‚ÄúEnable RT STFT masking‚Äù
   Body: Summarize column-atlas flip, ‚â§16 drains, mono path, latency set, RT-safe buffers.
6. SHARE: Paste a brief test log (sample counts, drainsPerBlock spikes while painting) and any assertions added.

Implementation notes (must-dos)

* In RealtimeSpectral::processBlock(), replace any dynamic ‚Äústd::vector<float> timeWin = ‚Ä¶‚Äù style copies with a preallocated member buffer (e.g., timeWin\_) sized fftSize; copy into it and reuse every hop.
* Keep spec\_ as the interleaved real-only FFT buffer of length fftSize (JUCE real FFT format).
* OLA: write exactly hop samples to output each hop; accumulate the remaining fftSize-hop into the OLA ring; advance writePos by hop modulo ring size.
* Preserve phase by uniform scaling of re/imag; s = mask\[k] (no recomputation of phase).
* Treat maskCol==nullptr as all-ones without branching inside the innermost loop if possible (e.g., pass a pointer to a static 1.0 array or use a fastpath).

Deliverables

* New files: Core/MaskAtlas.h, DSP/HopScheduler.h, DSP/RealtimeSpectral.h
* Processor integration edits: prepareToPlay(), processBlock(), includes, members.
* Unified diff patch and the commit message described above.
* Confirmation of latency value and pluginval output.
* One-screen QA notes confirming painting ‚Üí audible attenuation and HUD metrics during paint.

End of task.
